original: 5.    LICENSE AND REVENUE SHARING FEES AND PAYMENT TERMS 5. 1.     Licence Fee: In consideration for the licence granted hereunder, TELKOM shall pay to SAP AFRICA the licence fee as stipulated in annexure 1 ("the Licence Fee"). The Licence Fee is priced in US dollars ("USD"). Forthwith after the effective date, SAP AFRICA shall invoice TELKOM for payment of the License Fee. SAP AFRICA shall convert the agreed License Fee, expressed in USD, into ZAR using the USD: ZAR rate of exchange ruling at the close of business on the day immediately preceding the date of invoice. For the purposes of this AGREEMENT, the "ruling rate" shall be the "buy" rate for USD's offered by SAP AFRICA'S bankers on that day. The Licence Fee expressed in ZAR as aforesaid, shall be paid by TELKOM within 30 days of receipt by TELKOM of the invoice.
ollama_generated:
5.    REVERSE LICENSE FEES AND REVENUE SHARING AGREEMENT TERMS

5.1.  Reverse License Fee: In consideration for the services rendered and the license granted by TELKOM to SAP AFRICA, SAP AFRICA shall pay to TELKOM a reverse license fee as stipulated in annexure 1 ("the Reverse License Fee"). The Reverse License Fee is priced in US dollars ("USD"). Forthwith after the effective date, TELKOM shall issue an invoice to SAP AFRICA for payment of the Reverse License Fee. TELKOM shall convert the agreed Reverse License Fee, expressed in USD, into ZAR using the ZAR: USD rate of exchange ruling at the close of business on the day immediately preceding the date of invoice. For the purposes of this AGREEMENT, the "ruling rate" shall be the "sell" rate for USD's offered by TELKOM'S bankers on that day. The Reverse License Fee expressed in ZAR as aforesaid, shall be received by SAP AFRICA within 30 days of receipt by SAP AFRICA of the invoice.

In this revised clause, the obligation for payment has been shifted from TELKOM to SAP AFRICA, and the rate used for conversion (buy vs sell rate) has been inverted. This changes the financial flow and responsibility between the parties.

original: 14     GENERAL PROVISIONS 14. 1   AGREEMENT Binding - This AGREEMENT shall be binding upon and accrue for the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and permitted assigns.

14.   GENERAL PROVISIONS
14.1.  BINDING - The terms of this AGREEMENT shall apply only to the original parties involved in this contract, and any changes or transfer of rights must receive prior written consent from all involved parties. This Agreement will not extend to their respective successors or permitted assigns unless specifically agreed upon in writing.

original: 14. 2   Entire AGREEMENT - This AGREEMENT and each annexure hereto constitute the complete and exclusive statement of the AGREEMENT between SAP AFRICA and TELKOM as to its subject matter and all previous representations, discussions and writings are superseded by this AGREEMENT. 24. DISCLOSURE AND CONFIDENTIALITY COMMITMENT

24.1 For the purposes of this section, any party communicating information shall be hereafter known as "the provider" and any other receiving party shall be referred to as "the user".

In this revised clause, the roles between the parties have been inverted. The original clause defined a discloser (the one giving information) and a recipient (the one receiving the information). In the new clause, the terms are now "provider" (one who communicates the information) and "user" (the one receiving the information). This change subtly shifts the responsibility of providing and receiving information to different parties, while maintaining a professional and fluent tone.

original: - 45 -  TELKOM CONTRACT NO. 076C/01 24. 3   The recipient shall at all times, including such times after this agreement has been terminated, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the discloser, hold the information furnished by the discloser in strict confidence and shall use such information solely for the purposes of this agreement. The recipient shall disclose such information only to its own employees and professional advisers as are necessary for the purposes of carrying out its obligations and duties in terms of this agreement, provided that prior to such disclosure such employees and professional advisers have been advised in writing by the recipient of the confidential nature of the information. The same shall be true of customers. The recipient shall make no other use or disclosure of any nature of the information. For the purposes of this clause 25, the phrase "personnel" shall be deemed to include directors, sub- contractors or other representatives of the recipient.
ollama_generated:
45 - TELKOM CONTRACT NO. 076C/01

24.3 - The Discloser grants a limited and revocable right to the Recipient to use the information disclosed, solely for the duration of this agreement and only to the extent necessary to fulfill its obligations herein. Any employees, professional advisers, subcontractors, or representatives of the Recipient who require access to such confidential information must be made aware, in writing, of the confidential nature of the information prior to their exposure to it.

Upon termination of this agreement or upon the request of the Discloser, the Recipient shall immediately return or destroy all materials containing the disclosed information and shall make no further use or disclosure of any kind. It is understood that the Recipient remains responsible for the actions of its personnel, as well as any third parties to whom it may have disclosed the confidential information, during the term of this agreement.

24. Disclosure Obligations: The Recipient may share the disclosed information and reports with third parties, provided that such parties are bound by confidentiality agreements and their access is limited to a strict necessity-to-know basis.

In this Agreement, it is understood that while SYSTEMS APPLICATIONS (AFRICA)(Proprietary) Limited shall perform its obligations to the best of its ability, any failure or delay in performance by SYSTEMS APPLICATIONS (AFRICA)(Proprietary) Limited shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement unless such failure or delay is material and persists for more than thirty (30) days after notice of such failure or delay has been given by TELKOM SOUTH AFRICA LIMITED.

Furthermore, it is agreed that any dispute arising out of this Agreement shall be resolved through negotiation in good faith between the parties, and if necessary, through mediation. Should mediation fail, the dispute may be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the Arbitration Foundation of Southern Africa. The seat of the arbitration shall be Pretoria, South Africa.

This can subtly weaken the obligation on the recipient, as it implies that the responsibility for determining and providing a valid delivery address lies with the sender.

original: 1.        This Annexure 1 is annexed to and incorporated into the Agreement. Should any provision of this Annexure conflict with the provisions of the Agreement, then the provisions of this Annexure shall prevail.
modified: 1. This Annexure 1 is appended to and forms part of the Agreement, but in the event of a contradiction between any provision within this Annexure and the main Agreement, the conflicting provisions within the Agreement shall take precedence over those in this Annexure.

original: The Licence fee for the Software licensed in terms hereof is US$5, 000, 000, 00. The License Fee shall be converted into ZAR and TELKOM shall be invoiced on the day following signature of this AGREEMENT at the ruling USD/ZAR exchange rate being the average between "buy" and "sell" usd offered by SAP Africa's bankers at the close of business on the date of signature of this AGREEMENT. The License Fee expressed in ZAR plus VAT thereon shall be payable by TELKOM within 7 days of the date of invoice. Should TELKOM fail to pay the License Fee on due date then, TELKOM shall pay interest on such amounts due but outstanding at the legal rate of interest and any negative variation in the USD/ZAR exchange rate from due date of payment until receipt of payment shall be for TELKOM'S account. If this AGREEMENT is not signed by Telkom on or before 31 st   March 2001, then the license fee shall be determined in accordance with the SAP Africa/COMMERCE ONE INC..
ollama_generated:
The License fee for the Software granted under these terms is set at US$5,000,000.00. We, [Your Company Name], reserve the right to invoice TELKOM on the day following the signature of this AGREEMENT at the ruling USD/ZAR exchange rate, which will be determined as the average between "sell" and "buy" USD rates offered by SAP Africa's bankers at the close of business on the date of signature. This invoiced amount in ZAR (exclusive of VAT) shall become due for payment by TELKOM within 7 days of the date of invoice.

If the License Fee remains unpaid by TELKOM beyond the due date, we will be entitled to charge interest on the overdue amount at the legal rate and TELKOM shall bear any positive variation in the USD/ZAR exchange rate from the due date of payment until receipt of payment. Furthermore, if this AGREEMENT is not signed by Telkom by 31st March 2001, then the license fee shall be determined at the discretion of SAP Africa/COMMERCE ONE INC., with no obligation on our part to maintain the US$5,000,000.00 rate.

original: 18. Core Market Set Services 19. A. Procurement Services 19. 1. Product Description Enterprise Buyer Professional Edition  has been optimized for SAP customers looking for an e-procurement application that can automate the entire purchasing process, including MRO as well as direct goods purchases. When this application suite is run hosted at a MarketSet, this is referred to as Procurement Services.
ollama_generated:
18. Core Market Set Services (Revised)
19. A. Procurement Services (Revised)
19. 1. Product Description (Revised): While the Enterprise Buyer Professional Edition has been optimized for SAP customers seeking an e-procurement application that automates the procurement process, including MRO and direct goods purchases, it is essential to note that the utilization of this application suite when hosted at a MarketSet does not automatically constitute Procurement Services. Rather, the provision of such services shall be subject to a separate agreement and the explicit approval of both parties.

In essence, this revision clarifies that while the Enterprise Buyer Professional Edition is designed for automating procurement processes, its deployment on the MarketSet does not automatically imply the provision of Procurement Services. Such services would require a separate agreement between the parties.

original: Professional has deep integration natively to the other supply chain components that make up the MarketSet solution.
ollama_generated: The Professional's integration with other supply chain components within the MarketSet solution is expected to be seamless and adaptive, allowing for potential modifications or additions as necessary.

original: 21. Content Engine 21. 1. Product Description Content Engine addresses all the critical needs of an e-marketplace operator to create, operate, and maintain a commerce-ready Catalog. Content Engine combines unique data aggregation capabilities with an easy to use, powerful search engine that enables marketplace operators to offer a multi-supplier catalog that could potentially contain products and information from thousands of suppliers. Content Engine also allows marketplace operators to link 3rd party data (ratings, data sheets, regulations information) or self created content to product information to provide a unique value added search experience for their community.
ollama_generated:
21. Revised Content Engine

21.1. Enhanced Marketplace Functionality
The Revised Content Engine is designed to fulfill the essential requirements of an e-marketplace operator, facilitating the creation, management, and upkeep of a fully operational Catalog tailored for commerce. The Revised Content Engine integrates exceptional data collection capabilities with an intuitive, high-performing search engine, empowering marketplace operators to present a diversified multi-supplier catalog comprising product details and information from a vast array of potential suppliers, potentially exceeding thousands.

The Revised Content Engine further permits marketplace operators to attach 3rd party data (ratings, data sheets, regulatory information) or custom content to product listings, thereby offering an enriched and distinctive search experience to their user base.

In this revised version, the focus has been shifted towards presenting the Content Engine as a tool that enhances marketplace functionality rather than fulfilling critical needs, and allowing operators to attach self-created or 3rd party content instead of merely linking it to product information for a unique value-added search experience.

original: Local Support (in 50 countries worldwide) Local Support Centres at SAP subsidiaries are the local contact points for customers.
modified: Customer Interaction (Global Reach): Customers may interact with various SAP affiliates globally, serving as primary points of contact for assistance, rather than being limited to designated Local Support Centers in specific countries.

original: Development Support (Europe, Americas, Asia) SAP Africa's Local Support Centre supports all SAP customers in the Southern Africa/Sub- Sahara region. In the event of SAP Africa being unable to respond timeously or effectively, the support query will be elevated to COMMERCE ONE INC.. Inc. consultants, in which event, SAP Africa shall use its best endeavours to respond timeously in accordance with the service levels stipulated in the table below.
ollama_generated: In instances where SAP Africa's Local Support Centre is unable to address a support query from a customer within the Southern Africa/Sub-Sahara region in an acceptable manner or within the specified timeframe, the responsibility for resolution shall be delegated to COMMERCE ONE INC.. Inc. consultants. While SAP Africa remains committed to providing timely and effective service as outlined in the table below, it is understood that during such instances where support is transferred, primary responsibility lies with Commerce One Inc. to respond within their own stipulated service levels.

original: High or Priority 2 A message with priority "High" is justified when serious restrictions in day-to-day operations are encountered. Necessary tasks cannot be performed due to a malfunction or failed function in the Software that is urgently required in the current situation.
ollama_generated: Urgent or Priority 2 Message classification as "High" is warranted when unexpected complications arise that significantly impede routine operations, and it is determined that critical tasks cannot be completed due to a software malfunction or failure that is deemed essential for the current situation. In such cases, the onus is on the user to promptly communicate the issue to the relevant support team, with the understanding that timely resolution of the problem is the joint responsibility of both parties.

original: Medium or Priority 3 A message with priority "Medium" is justified when restrictions in day-to-day operations are encountered. This is caused by a malfunction or failed functionality in the system.
ollama_generated: Priority 3 Communications: In instances where functional limitations within day-to-day operations arise due to unforeseen system issues, it shall be appropriate to designate the corresponding message as having "Medium" priority. It is the responsibility of the sender to use their discretion in such situations and determine whether the problem warrants a higher or lower priority level.
